summarized_info: I received a text message from Ping An Health's customer service, mentioning that I browsed their medical insurance and cancer insurance products for individuals over 60 years old this afternoon.

message_content: Zheng Kai: I'm waiting for you at the Yunnan rice noodle shop on the third floor. Let me know when you arrive.

Me: I saw a particularly beautiful scarf woven by a craftsman in Danba, so I bought one. The pattern is the traditional Eight Auspicious Symbols design, and I think you'll like it. I'll give it to you when you get back.

Zhou Tao: Regarding the shelves we looked at last time at the Hangzhou venue, I think the metal ones are more practical, but you prefer the wooden ones? I've found a few pictures to send you for reference.

Zhang Wei: Is the physical fitness test over? How were the results?  
Lei Mingxuan: Just finished. The data isn't too optimistic. I'll show you the report with specific numbers tonight.
Mom, Dad and I are at the East Hospital. The treatment has just finished, and we're currently handling the discharge procedures.
Hello Aunt Li, I'm Lei Mingxuan. The contract has been signed. As we agreed on the app, you can come directly every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday afternoon. Thank you for your hard work!
Brother Xuan, Miss Feng came by this morning and bought that functional jacket as you recommended. Also, the foot traffic is still low at noon. I'm keeping an eye on things here, so don't worry.
Me: My dad suggested we organize a small outdoor activity in the community while taking a walk yesterday. Do you think it's feasible?

Okay, Brother Zheng, sorry to trouble you. I'll send you the dimensions of the new equipment later, so we can figure out the most convenient way to arrange it in the warehouse. Today's lunch break chat at the ramen shop in the mall was quite productive.

Lei Mingxuan: I was busy at the shop yesterday and didn't have time to check my phone. I spent a long time packing in the afternoon, and there were also many customer inquiries. Now I feel completely worn out.
Good afternoon, Mr. Lei! The mall is preparing for the year-end promotional event and would like to invite you to join the planning meeting. Are you interested?

Fang Jie: Mingxuan, I've sent the price for the T-shirt fabric you inquired about last time to your WeChat. Please check it. The price of summer fabrics has slightly increased, so if you need to place an order, please notify us as soon as possible.
Li Na: @Lei Mingxuan @Zhang Wei Haven't been active for a while, how's everyone doing lately? I just finished a big promotion project and I'm exhausted.
Zhang Wei: I'm doing okay, but there's been a minor issue at home recently. Lele (Zhang Wei's son) broke out in a rash a few days ago, so we took him to the hospital for a check-up.
Lei Mingxuan: Huh? Is it serious? What kind of rash?

Zhang Wei: It turns out to be an allergy to milk protein. The doctor said many children have this issue. Now we have to switch to specially formulated milk powder and baby food, which is a bit of a hassle.
Li Na: Ah, this... raising a child is really not easy. Brother Wei, you've worked hard, take care. Brother Xuan, how has your shop business been lately?
Shen Jie: Bro, I went to that independent coffee shop you recommended last time, and the beans were really good. What beans are you using at home now?
Lei Mingxuan: I've been a bit obsessed with "special processing methods" lately. My teacher mentioned it briefly during the SCA course, so I bought a few types to try myself.
Shen Jie: Special treatment? That sounds expensive. What kind specifically?

Lei Mingxuan: Exactly, especially the anaerobic fermented ones. I got some Panama Geisha and brewed it with a siphon. The flavor profile was absolutely incredible—floral notes, peach, berries, and even a hint of red wine. It was so complex and exhilarating, way more exciting than traditional washed or natural processed coffee.
Shen Jie: No wonder you're the boss, Lei. You're getting more and more professional (and expensive) in your hobbies. Next time I'll drop by your shop for a taste.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, are you busy? I just finished talking with Chen Hao. He recently attended an internet product salon in Hangzhou and met a really interesting person.
Lei Mingxuan: Not busy, just closed the shop. Salon? Who did you run into?

Li Na: A game producer who switched jobs from Shanghai to Hangzhou, now working on independent games. After a long chat with Chen Hao, she said that leaving the big company and investing all her savings into it has been incredibly tough, but being in control of what she creates brings an overwhelming sense of achievement.
Lei Mingxuan: Wow, that's quite bold. What did Chen Hao say? Didn't he previously think the gaming industry was all about overtime and KPIs?

Li Na: Exactly, so he was deeply moved. He said after listening, he felt that the path of game development, especially indie games, though risky, allows one to truly create something, and the sense of value is different. It seems his perspective has been somewhat refreshed.
Lin Jing: Brother Xuan, I saw on your Moments that you've added a few new dolls! Are they from Dimoo's Fairy Tale series? Everyone's into that these days.
Leimingxuan: Haha, not Dimoo. It's Ayan's 'Retro Radio' series, I just got a whole box. I've also seen the fairy tale series, the design is nice, but it's not really my cup of tea.
Lin Jing: Ayan? This designer doesn't seem to be particularly popular. What are your current criteria for collecting dolls? It seems like the ones you collect aren't the hottest on the market.

Lei Mingxuan: To be honest, I don’t pay much attention to whether an IP is trending or not these days. I value the designer’s personal style more—for example, Ayan’s slightly melancholic and narrative tone, or some designers who use colors boldly. I believe this is the soul of trendy toys, and it’s more interesting than chasing popular trends with the crowd.

Lin Jing: I see! You have a collector's mindset, valuing the artistic expression itself. No wonder those pieces in your cabinet, at first glance, may not be recognizable, but upon closer inspection, they all have a unique charm.
Gao Yuan, let's handle the Japan trip as we discussed tonight.

Lei Mingxuan: I really enjoyed our lunch conversation today. Your suggestions were very professional and helped clarify many of my thoughts. I’ll leave the matter of the investment information to you, and I appreciate your help in advance!
Hey Zhang Wei, are you free next Saturday afternoon? I'd like to invite you to experience a VR project I just found out about—it seems pretty interesting.

Master He: Mr. Lei, after inspection, the wear on your vehicle's tires has reached the replacement standard. For the safety of your National Day road trip, we strongly recommend replacing all worn tires.
Zhang Wei: Mingxuan, Nana has been a bit troubled lately.
Lei Mingxuan: Huh? What's wrong? Did she encounter trouble at work?

Zhang Wei: It's not about work; it's her rented apartment. The water pipe in the upstairs neighbor's house burst in the middle of the night, and the water leaked down, soaking the ceilings and walls of her living room and bedroom, leaving a complete mess.
Lei Mingxuan: That's awful! Where is she living now? What did the landlord say?

Zhang Wei: The landlord and the upstairs neighbor are negotiating compensation and repairs. Nana can only temporarily move to a hotel near the company these days. She says it’s both troublesome and affects her mood, and she hopes every day that the repairs will be completed soon so she can move back.
Lin Jing: Mingxuan, have you seen the new 'Secret Forest' series released by Pop Mart recently? I think the design of that fox spirit is absolutely stunning!
Lei Mingxuan: I did! I was just about to tell you. Lately, I don’t know if it’s because I’m getting older or because I spend every day in the mall, but I’ve been really longing for nature.
Lin Jing: Haha, so your taste in collections has changed?

Lei Mingxuan: Yes, I feel a bit tired of those flashy and trendy styles now. Instead, I really like this forest-themed style, with elements like leaves, vines, and small animals blended together. It brings a sense of calm just by looking at it, as if bringing a small piece of the forest back home.

Lin Jing: Got it, you're now following the 'natural healing' collection route. Then I'll keep an eye out for you. Besides 'Secret Forest', it seems there's also a 'Jungle Adventure' series in this style.
Shen Jie: Bro, are you at the shop? I just passed by a newly opened boutique near Jing'an Temple, and its style is pretty cool. I think you might be interested.

Lei Mingxuan: I'm here, just finished a busy period. What's the name of the shop? I'll check it out later. By the way, have you been in touch with Xiaofan recently? He mentioned last time that his project was about to launch and he was swamped with work.
Shen Jie: It's called 'Fog City', on Yuyuan Road. Xiao Fan, I've contacted him. He was really down in the dumps a few days ago.
Lei Mingxuan: What's up? Tortured by demands again?

Shen Jie: More annoying than the demand. He said that the recommendation algorithm he was responsible for was originally scheduled to go live next week, but the testing team discovered a boundary condition bug, claiming that under certain extreme circumstances, the recommendation results would completely deviate, affecting the user experience. To fix this, he worked overtime for three consecutive days at the company in Hangzhou, nearly causing the project to be delayed, but he finally managed to resolve it. Now he's completely exhausted and says he never wants to see those lines of code again.

Lin Wei: Honey, are you free this weekend? There are a few new movies out recently. One sci-fi film is said to have amazing special effects, and there's also a romantic art film that seems to have good reviews. Which one would you like to watch?

Lei Mingxuan: Just finished inventory, exhausted. Sci-fi sounds good, exciting. Art films... they're okay too, as long as they're not too boring. Just don't pick those historical biopics—I really can't get into them.

Lin Wei: Haha, I knew you wouldn't like that kind of movie. Last time I went with you to watch that biographical film about a painter, you started playing with your phone within half an hour of it starting.

Lei Mingxuan: Don't even mention it. The pace is too slow—they can spend a full minute focusing on a single painting, and I tend to lose focus. I prefer films with some plot conflict or strong visual impact. I also enjoy suspenseful crime movies.
Lin Wei: Alright, alright, let's settle on the sci-fi one first. The suspense film isn't coming out until next Friday, so we can watch that then.

Lei Mingxuan: Mr. Zhou, urgent! I have a client here who needs a batch of solid-color T-shirts with prints and logos. They must be delivered to Suzhou tomorrow. How many pieces can you allocate from your Hangzhou warehouse? I'll send you the specifications right away.

Lin Wei: Mingxuan, regarding the offline pop-up event we discussed yesterday, I've given it some more thought. I've met the person in charge of 'Frontier Box' at an event before, so I can help you gauge their interest first. They would likely be interested in a weekend pop-up format, but we need a preliminary plan from your side regarding the specific theme and profit-sharing model. Could you start brainstorming what unique elements we could offer for collaboration under the 'Pudong Trendsetter' theme?
Lei Mingxuan: Jiajia, I checked the weather forecast, and the weather will be bad this afternoon. Should we cancel our planned outdoor activity? Safety first.
Song Jia: Okay, got it. Let's make plans another day then.
Zheng Kai: Meet at the new Chinese restaurant on the third floor of the mall tomorrow at 12 noon sharp. Remember to prepare some initial ideas for the Valentine's Day promotion.

Xu Feng: Hello, Mr. Lei. The financial interview tomorrow afternoon has been confirmed. The time is 15:10, and the location is set at the Tims Coffee on Nanchang Road, as we discussed in our previous phone call. Looking forward to meeting you.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, are you there? I just had a phone call with Brother Wei, and I feel like he hasn't been doing well lately.
Lei Mingxuan: What's wrong, Nana? Hasn't he been quite busy lately?

Li Na: Yes, exactly, it's because he's too busy that problems have arisen. The new product launch project he's in charge of was almost ready to go, but then the partner suddenly changed their mind and insisted on altering the core marketing strategy.
Lei Mingxuan: Wow, isn't this starting from scratch? That will definitely delay the progress.

Li Na: Absolutely. He said the entire project is stuck now, with the higher-ups pushing hard and the partners being difficult to deal with. The pressure is immense. He's been rarely active in our "Pudong Three Musketeers" group chat lately.
Lei Mingxuan: Jingjing, have you had any new finds in collecting dolls recently? I feel like my own tastes have changed.
Lin Jing: Oh? How so? Do share! I've been following that new mecha series lately, and the colors are absolutely dazzling.

Lei Mingxuan: Haha, I used to absolutely love the kind you mentioned. But now, maybe because I'm getting older or because the shops are filled with too many flashy things that feel a bit overwhelming, I've started to prefer those with lighter colors and simpler designs.
Lin Jing: Got it, shifting from "street-storming styles" to "healing series," right? Like some of Molly's monochrome series or Dimoo's Dreamland?

Lei Mingxuan: Yes, yes, exactly! That's the feeling. Placing it in a corner at home or in a shop, just looking at it brings a sense of calm. The ones I've collected recently are all in color schemes of off-white, light gray, and pale blue.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, are you busy? I have something to tell you—Brother Wei's family is about to have a big celebration!
Lei Mingxuan: What good news? Did he get a promotion and a raise?
Li Na: Even happier than that! His wife is pregnant again! Just announced in the group chat, the due date is next spring.
Lei Mingxuan: Wow! Really? This is to make a 'good' character! His son is already in kindergarten, right? Now the pressure is even greater.

Li Na: Yeah, his son will be in the middle class in the second half of the year. Brother Wei said that although the pressure is high, having a new addition to the family is always a happy thing. Should we, the Three Musketeers of Pudong, prepare some gift money? Haha.
Shen Jie: Bro, any good historical novels to recommend lately? I'm running out of books to read.
Lei Mingxuan: I just finished reading a book called "The Lychee of Chang'an" by Ma Boyong, and it's quite interesting.
Shen Jie: What is it about? Is it another story about emperors, generals, and ministers?

Lei Mingxuan: No, on the contrary. It tells the story of a minor official who manages to accomplish an almost impossible task—transporting fresh lychees from Lingnan to Chang'an. Nowadays, I'm not particularly fond of stories that focus solely on the lofty halls of power, filled with nothing but political schemes and calculations.

Lei Mingxuan: I prefer stories that adopt the perspective of ordinary people, depicting how they struggle, live, and fulfill their small missions amid the currents of history. It feels more authentic and grounded in everyday life.
Lei Jianguo: Xuanxuan, Mom has prepared steamed perch and boiled shrimp. Come home quickly and let's celebrate together!
Shen Jie: Bro, what have you been up to lately? I noticed you haven't been updating your social media much.

Lei Mingxuan: Recently, I've been reading a historical novel called "The Rise and Fall in the Business World" every night, and it's quite interesting. It tells the story of how a fictional Jiangnan Shen family started their business during the Ming Dynasty.
Shen Jie: Oh? Is it good? What's it about?

Lei Mingxuan: It's interesting. The Shen family was particularly skilled in business. The book says they 'facilitated trade between the north and south, adapting to the times,' dealing in silk, tea, porcelain, and everything else. Moreover, they were especially adept at adjusting their goods according to the preferences of people in different regions.

Lei Mingxuan: I was quite touched after reading it. Their flexibility and ability to closely follow market demands resonate with my experience of running a shop. I also have to keep an eye on trends and update my products in a timely manner. Moreover, they seem to place great emphasis on maintaining relationships with regular customers, which aligns perfectly with my idea of building the "Urban Pulse Enthusiasts" community.

Lei Mingxuan: Brother Feng, I've saved up some money recently. Besides continuing to invest in funds regularly, are there any other stable options? I've noticed that many banks are promoting large-denomination certificates of deposit.

Xu Feng: Mingxuan, large-denomination certificates of deposit are indeed a relatively mainstream conservative investment option at the moment. The advantage is that they are absolutely principal-guaranteed, with fixed interest rates that are slightly higher than regular fixed deposits. What are your thoughts?

Lei Mingxuan: I've done some research. It's safe, but the drawbacks are quite evident. The annualized interest rate is only about 3%, which might not even keep up with inflation. Essentially, the money placed in there is actually losing value.

Lei Mingxuan: Moreover, the money is often locked in for three to five years. If there's an urgent need for funds during that period, early withdrawal results in significant interest losses, making it far too inflexible. It doesn't really suit my personality, as I might need to mobilize funds at any time for stocking up or seizing opportunities.

Xu Feng: The analysis is spot on. This is precisely the core contradiction of large-denomination certificates of deposit: low risk comes with low returns and low liquidity. Therefore, it is more suitable for funds that prioritize complete stability and are intended to remain untouched for the long term. In your case, perhaps you could consider combining it with some short-term bond funds or flexible redemption financial products.
Shen Jie: Bro, are you at the shop? I just passed by a boutique near Jing'an Temple and saw a few pieces that have a similar style to your 'Urban Corners' collection. Let me send you some photos.

Lei Mingxuan: I see. The silhouette is somewhat similar, but the fabric and details are far from it. We are still using the new functional fabric from Brother Tao. By the way, have you been in touch with Nana recently? She mentioned last time that things seem a bit unstable at her company.

Shen Jie: I've been in touch with her, and she's been quite down lately. Their e-commerce platform in Hangzhou has been undergoing organizational restructuring, and the new business line project she was in charge of was abruptly terminated. The entire team is now in a state of panic, and I heard they plan to downsize by half. She's struggling with whether to wait for compensation and leave or quickly transfer to another internal position.

Lei Mingxuan: Sigh, that's just how the internet industry is—it changes so fast. I remember her saying last year that the project was a priority for the company. Tell her that if she’s really not happy in Hangzhou, she can come back to Shanghai anytime. I can help her look for opportunities here, or you can help her there. We, the 'Three Musketeers of Pudong,' can't drift apart.
Han Dong: Xuan Ge, pool at the usual spot tonight, 7 o'clock? After the game, how about heading to that newly opened Chaoshan beef hotpot place next door?

Lei Mingxuan: No problem, see you at 7. Hot pot is fine, it’s a good way to replenish protein. By the way, I’ve been drinking a new functional beverage after workouts recently, and I feel it helps with recovery better than before. I’ll bring a bottle for you to try after the game.
Han Dong: What brand? Like Red Bull? I can't sleep at night if I drink that.

Lei Mingxuan: It's not an energy drink, it's for post-workout recovery. It's from a niche foreign brand recommended by my cousin Jiejie. It focuses on electrolytes and BCAAs, and the key is that it's completely sugar-free—it has a very light mineral water taste, which I really like. I've been drinking it for a few weeks, and I feel like my muscles aren't as sore the day after playing basketball or running.
Han Dong: No sugar is good, I'm also controlling my sugar intake now. Alright, bring it over tonight and I'll give it a try. If it's good, I'll buy some too. See you at 7!
Mom, I went to Chengshan Road today and visited several elderly care product stores to help Dad choose a walker. One store had a pretty comprehensive selection of products, and I took some photos.
Lei Mingxuan: President Zhou, the meeting minutes have been sent to your email. Please focus on reviewing the new scenario requirements section we emphasized.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, I'm so frustrated lately, I feel like I can't keep going with my job.
Lei Mingxuan: What's wrong, Nana? Isn't your company quite stable?

Li Na: The company recently underwent a structural adjustment, and our department is transitioning to live-streaming e-commerce. My supervisor talked to me and suggested that I switch from product operations to live-streaming sales, saying that my outgoing personality is well-suited for it.
Lei Mingxuan: Live streaming sales? That's completely different from what you used to do. Are you interested?

Li Na: I'm not interested at all! And I feel I'm not cut out for it; I get nervous in front of the camera. After all these years in operations, I feel like the experience I've gained is going to waste, and it's making me really anxious.
Lin Jing: Xuan Ge, have you seen the new 'Midnight Amusement Park' series from Pop Mart? The design of that clown is so unique, with a hint of dark fairy tale vibes.

Lei Mingxuan: After watching the trailer, I find the design of the stitches on the clown's face a bit hard to accept. I generally prefer something more cheerful, cool, or with a sense of storytelling.
Lin Jing: Haha, it seems you don't like overly eerie styles. I actually quite enjoy this kind with a touch of Gothic elements—it's impactful.

Lei Mingxuan: Exactly, I'm completely indifferent to those horror elements and dark themes. I can accept a realistic mecha style, but overly bloody and eerie designs feel odd to have at home. Something like Skullpanda, with a bit of streetwise coolness, suits me better.
Lin Jing: Got it, your collection preferences are quite clear. I'll @ you next time there's a sunny mecha or sporty style series.
Zhang Wei: Mingxuan, have you been in touch with Nana recently? I feel like she's been a bit down lately.
Lei Mingxuan: No, she was quite active in the group chat last week. What's up?

Zhang Wei: Didn't she tell you? The neighbor upstairs in her newly purchased apartment in Hangzhou has been renovating recently, with the sound of electric drills going from morning till night, making it impossible for her to sleep. She's even developed dark circles under her eyes. She complained to me that she's almost on the verge of a nervous breakdown.
Lei Mingxuan: Huh? She really didn't mention this. No wonder her recent social media posts have been all about late-night overtime and coffee. Did she communicate with the property management?

Zhang Wei: I've communicated with them. The property management said the renovation time is compliant, so they can only mediate. She's considering whether to stay at a friend's place for a few days to get some relief. Probably, she feels that telling us wouldn't solve the problem and would only add to the frustration, so she didn't mention it in the group chat.
Lin Jing: Mingxuan, have you come across any trendy toy creations lately that really caught your eye? It feels like the designs on the market are becoming a bit too similar.

Lei Mingxuan: Indeed. However, I've been paying attention to a few domestic designers lately. Compared to those who focus purely on cuteness or coolness, I prefer those who can creatively incorporate our own cultural elements.
Lin Jing: For example? Specifically, what kind of fusion do you like?

Lei Mingxuan: For example, a designer deconstructed the patterns of Peking Opera facial makeup and applied them to a trendy skateboarder's toy, or combined blue-and-white porcelain patterns with a cyberpunk mechanical arm. This kind of design has both roots and a trendy vibe, making it a perfect fit for my store.

Lin Jing: Got it! You've always had quite unique tastes. This fusion of national trends indeed has its own flavor. I'll keep an eye out for new releases or exhibition information from designers in this style for you.
Zhang Wei: Xuanzi, Nana has been really worried lately.
Lei Mingxuan: Huh? What's wrong? Did she have a problem at work?
Zhang Wei: It's not about work, it's about the apartment. The landlord of the place she's renting suddenly said they want to sell it and gave her a month to move out.
Lei Mingxuan: Damn, so sudden? Is the rental market in Hangzhou that tight now? Has she found a new place yet?

Zhang Wei: I'm still looking for one, checking out apartments every day, it's really annoying. I was living just fine, and then suddenly this happens, messing up all my plans. At least we don't have to worry about this.
Lin Jing: Mingxuan, have you drawn from the newly released Forest Concert series? The colors are so vibrant.
Lei Mingxuan: I've seen it, but I haven't made a move. I feel like my taste has changed now.
Lin Jing: Oh? How has it changed? Weren't you the one who loved this kind of lively style the most before?

Lei Mingxuan: Yes, but now, looking at all the colorful items in the store and at home, it feels a bit overwhelming. Lately, I've actually become fascinated with designs that are simple and feature soft, muted colors, like the Morandi palette. Having them around brings a sense of calm to my mind.
Lin Jing: Got it, so you've transitioned from a passionate youth to a literary middle age, huh? Haha. But minimalist style is indeed timeless.
Lei Mingxuan: Hey guys, any interesting news lately? I’ve been busy with upgrading my shop, but now I can finally take a breather.
contactName: Pudong Three Musketeers (Zhang Wei, Li Na)

message_content: Zhang Wei: Same old, same old here. But yesterday, I was talking to Liu Yang on the phone, and he vented about something that had me in stitches.
contactName: The Three Musketeers of Pudong (Zhang Wei, Li Na)

message_content: Li Na: Tell me quickly, what's wrong with Yangyang? Did she buy some strange figurine again?
contactName: The Three Musketeers of Pudong (Zhang Wei, Li Na)

message_content: Zhang Wei: Exactly! Didn't he also treat himself to a PS5 recently, just like you? Then he got hooked on "God of War: Ragnarok" and stayed up several nights in a row at his apartment in Shenzhen to finish the game.

Zhang Wei: The next day at work, I was still in a daze. While carrying coffee, my hand slipped, and the entire cup of Americano spilled all over the newly arrived, supposedly thousands-of-yuan limited edition EVA Unit-01 figurine next to his workstation! He was heartbroken, yet felt he deserved it—caught between laughter and tears.
Xu Feng: Mingxuan, you mentioned last time that you were taking a barista course. How's your skill level now? What do you think of the beans at this place today?

Lei Mingxuan: Still exploring, but I've become much more sensitive to the flavors of the beans. This place probably uses a washed Yirgacheffe—clean, with bright acidity, but it's not my recent favorite.
Xu Feng: Oh? So what style do you prefer now?

Lei Mingxuan: I've been really into honey-processed beans lately. Especially those from Costa Rica or Panama. Sometimes natural-processed beans have too much fermentation flavor, while washed beans feel like they lack complexity. Honey-processed beans are just right—they have a rich sweetness, a full body, and very clear fruity notes, like yellow peach or apricot. They're perfect for my pour-over brewing.
Xu Feng: That sounds very professional. It seems that with that coffee corner in your shop, you can consider yourself half an expert already.
Zhang Wei: Mingxuan, Nana has been really impressive lately!
Lei Mingxuan: What's wrong? What big commotion has she caused again?

Zhang Wei: Isn't she at that e-commerce company in Hangzhou? Last month, she successfully got promoted to Senior Product Operations Specialist through an internal competition! Her salary has increased significantly.
Lei Mingxuan: Impressive! Truly worthy of being the top student among our "Three Musketeers of Pudong."

Zhang Wei: It's not over yet. The new feature she's responsible for, the "Community Group Buying," has seen explosive data growth. I heard user engagement increased by over 30%. She just won the quarterly outstanding employee award, and the bonus is quite substantial too. She's showing off in the group chat, telling us to treat ourselves to a meal in Hangzhou at her expense.
Gao Yuan: Brother Mingxuan, have you been watching any new anime lately? Have you been keeping up with the second half of the second season of "Jujutsu Kaisen"?

Lei Mingxuan: I'm still following it. The fight scenes are as top-notch as ever. But to be honest, I've been feeling a bit of aesthetic fatigue lately—it's always the same old story of a hot-blooded teenager saving the world.
Gao Yuan: So what kind of shows do you like to watch now?

Lei Mingxuan: I've recently been really into the trope of "retired legends forced back into action." Like Twilight in "Spy x Family," who appears to be an ordinary office worker but is actually a master spy. Or something like "The Misfit of Demon King Academy," where the protagonist is so overpowered that all he wants is to relax, but trouble always finds him.

Gao Yuan: Got it, so he's the top dog in terms of strength but just wants to live a peaceful life, yet ends up being forced to show off, right? That kind of contrast is really compelling. I recommend you check out "The Black Summoner"—the main character is that type too.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, are you busy? I just finished a video call with Brother Wei, and I have some great news!
Lei Mingxuan: Just closed the shop, what's the good news? Did he get a promotion and a raise?
Li Na: Even happier than that! His wife is pregnant with their second child!
Leiming Xuan: Wow! Really? That's fantastic! When is the due date?
Li Na: It's said to be this summer, around July or August. Brother Wei said he'll officially announce it in the group chat once things are more stable, but I'm telling you in secret first.
Lin Jing: Brother Lei, have you seen the 2025 spring new product preview just released by Pop Mart? It feels like the style has really expanded this time.
Lei Mingxuan: Just took a quick glance. That retro cyber series is pretty cool, but personally, I think it might be a bit too hardcore and might not quite fit in my store.
Lin Jing: I feel the same. What about that plush healing style? It seems to be quite popular lately.
Lei Mingxuan: Too sweet, not my cup of tea. I'm actually most optimistic about the 'Shan Hai Jing Adventure' series.

Lei Mingxuan: Turning mythical beasts like Taotie and Bai Ze into trendy toys not only carries the traditional mythological flavor but also features designs that are trendy and street-style. I think this fusion of national trends really suits my taste and aligns with the vibe I want to create in my store.
Fang, I'm currently splitting the screen to organize today's sales accounts for the shop. I'll follow up on the jewelry logistics later, so please send me the tracking number first.
summarized_info: Lei Mingxuan sent a text message to supplier Wu Fang, mentioning the split-screen processing of the store's daily accounts and logistics confirmation.

message_content: Father: The family meeting has concluded, and everyone has agreed to postpone the purchase of new energy vehicles, opting to wait and see in the first half of next year.
Zhang Wei: Xuanzi, Nana hasn't been in good spirits lately; she's been talking less in the group chat.

Lei Mingxuan: I can sense it too. I just privately messaged her, and she said that the year-end work pressure is too high, with several consecutive weeks of overtime, and her stomach has been feeling uncomfortable.
Zhang Wei: Sigh, that's how internet companies are. What else did she say?
Lei Mingxuan: She said the new feature project she led didn't meet the KPI set by the boss in the year-end review, which was a bit of a blow, making her feel like all her hard work was in vain.

Zhang Wei: Got it. Let's chat with her more in the group chat over the weekend to offer some comfort and guidance. If that doesn't work, we can invite her to come to Shanghai during the New Year's holiday to relax and unwind.
Lin Jing: Brother Lei, have you tried the new Molly series from Pop Mart recently? I got two hidden ones!
Lei Mingxuan: Congratulations! My interests have shifted a bit recently, and I’ve been buying fewer blind boxes.
Lin Jing: Oh? What did you turn to? Did you quit the hobby?

Lei Mingxuan: Not really. I'm more into resin toys made by independent designers now, like those in the style of Chairman Ca or Koji Kamada. Each one is a work of art, released in limited editions, making them highly collectible. They also add a lot of style when displayed at home.
Lin Jing: Got it, shifting from mass production to high-end art collection. That circle has a high threshold, but the items are truly unique. Good taste!
Li Na: Brother Xuan, are you busy? I just had a phone call with Brother Wei (Zhang Wei), and I'm feeling a bit complicated.
Lei Mingxuan: Just closed the shop, what's up Nana? What happened to Brother Wei?

Li Na: It wasn't him, it was his son, Lele. Last week, their kindergarten held a parent-child sports day. Lele got too excited while running, tripped and fell, landing on his arm. An X-ray later revealed a minor fracture.
Lei Mingxuan: Huh? Is it serious? How is it now?

Li Na: The cast is on, and the doctor said it's not a big issue. Kids recover quickly. It's just that Xiaoya (Zhang Wei's wife) has to take a week off to take care of him at home, and Brother Wei also mentioned that he needs to cut back on overtime recently and go home early to lend a hand. The household has suddenly become quite busy.

Zhao Min: Mingxuan, I've noticed that the style of goods you've been stocking in your store has changed a bit recently, leaning more towards niche designs with a sense of style. Has your own taste in clothing changed?

Lei Mingxuan: Haha, you noticed. There has indeed been a bit of a change. In the past, I might have focused more on whether something was the latest and trendiest style, or if the fabric was particularly comfortable.

Lei Mingxuan: But now, especially since I've been running my own shop and have had more exposure, I find that if a piece of clothing has a story behind it or if the designer has a clear concept to express, it becomes particularly appealing to me.
Zhao Min: Oh? For example?

Lei Mingxuan: For example, the jacket I bought for myself last week—the designer drew inspiration from the window lattice patterns in Shanghai's old alleyways, and the attention to detail is quite interesting. Or the series made from eco-friendly recycled materials—while the fabric might not have the most premium feel, wearing it gives a different sensation. Whether a brand is big or its logo is prominent isn’t really what I care about the most anymore.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, have you been busy lately? I just chatted with Brother Wei for a while, and it seems there are some changes on his end.
Lei Mingxuan: Not bad, the shop just finished a busy period. What's up with Wei? Did he get promoted or change jobs?
Li Na: No job hopping, still with the old employer. But due to internal adjustments within their company, he was transferred to the newly established community group buying project team.
Lei Mingxuan: Community group buying? That's quite different from the fast-moving consumer goods market he was involved in before. What exactly is he responsible for?

Li Na: Yes, he said the challenge is quite significant. He is mainly responsible for market development in the East China region, building a team from scratch, finding suppliers, and is so busy that he barely has time to catch his breath.
Lin Jing: Mingxuan, have you tried the new Dimoo Space Traveler Series 2 from Pop Mart? I think the Nebula version is absolutely stunning.
Lei Mingxuan: I did, my luck was average, only got the basic version. But honestly, Jingjing, my taste has changed a bit recently.
Lin Jing: Oh? Defected from the Molly faction? Which series do you prefer now?

Lei Mingxuan: Haha, Molly is still loved. But recently, I've been particularly fascinated by Dimoo's design style, especially the themes that blend futuristic sci-fi elements, such as machinery and space, with natural ecology, like forests and flowers. It feels both imaginative and warm.

Lin Jing: Got it! You're referring to something like "Forest Concert" or "Mystical Forest," right? That kind of mix-and-match approach really adds depth, and the designer's creativity is truly impressive.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, are you busy? I just finished a video call with Brother Wei (Zhang Wei), and it was hilarious.
Lei Mingxuan: Just closed the shop, what's up? What embarrassing thing happened to Brother Wei again?

Li Na: It wasn't him, it was his son. Last week, their kindergarten held a parent-child sports event, and the little guy got so excited while running that he couldn't stop in time and ended up falling flat on the ground.
Lei Mingxuan: Huh? Is it serious?

Li Na: It's nothing, just a scraped knee with a band-aid on it. He was up and about the next day. Brother Wei said his wife was heartbroken at the time, but he himself thought it was normal for boys to have bumps and bruises.
Lin Jing: Brother Xuan, have you collected the entire box of the newly released "Dream Forest" series? I think the design is quite good.
Lei Mingxuan: No, I'm a bit short on cash lately, and my collecting strategy has changed somewhat.
Lin Jing: Oh? How so? You used to be a big fan of box sets.

Lei Mingxuan: Exactly. I used to think blind boxes were exciting, but there are too many duplicates, and dealing with them is a hassle. Now I feel it’s better to just buy the specific character I really like on Xianyu. For example, in the "Dream Forest" series, I only want the fox mage wearing a cloak.
Lin Jing: Got it, transitioning from a "gambler" to a "precision sniper." This approach is indeed more worry-free and easier on the wallet.
I bought a gift for my mom yesterday and spent a long time picking it out, hoping she'll like it.

Lei Mingxuan: Hello Ms. Wang, thank you for your understanding. We have arranged to replace your item with a new sweatshirt of the same style, and we will also include a pair of our trendy socks as compensation. I will send you the tracking number once the package is shipped. Wishing you a pleasant day!
summarized_info: I sent a text message to Ms. Wang to confirm the solution of exchanging the goods and offering trendy socks as a gift.

message_content: Li Na: Brother Xuan, are you busy? I have some gossip to tell you, about Haozi.
Lei Mingxuan: Just closed the shop. What's the gossip? What happened to Haozi?
Li Na: The internet company in Hangzhou where he used to work, which had always been talking about going public, finally did it recently!
Lei Mingxuan: Wow! Really? Then Haozi must have made a fortune, right? He got in pretty early.

Li Na: Exactly! As an early core employee, he holds a significant amount of stock options, and his net worth has multiplied several times over. He was even showing off in the group chat yesterday, saying he’d treat us to a lavish meal.
Shen Jie: Bro, have you pulled any good stuff lately? I went to Pop Mart last week and had terrible luck.
Lei Mingxuan: Haha, I'm just average too. But I've noticed my taste has changed—I used to like flashy things, but now I find them a bit overwhelming.
Shen Jie: Oh? What do you like now?

Lei Mingxuan: I've recently become obsessed with the "Imperial Auspicious Beasts" series. The designs are very minimalist, but they give traditional mythical creatures like qilins and pixius a modern touch with a hint of Chinese style. Displaying them at home feels much more stylish than those cartoonish ones.
Shen Jie: Wow, your taste has leveled up, bro! That series really has a sense of design, not childish at all. Want to try it together next time?
Yang Fan: Bro, how have you been lately? The atmosphere in our group has been a bit strange recently.
Lei Mingxuan: Not bad, busy wrapping up the Spring Festival activities. What's up with your team? Rushing another project?
Yang Fan: It's not about work. The algorithm expert sitting next to me, who is usually very steady, has been in a poor state recently and keeps making mistakes when writing code.
Lei Mingxuan: Something happened at home?

Yang Fan: Hmm. We had lunch together at noon, and he poured out his troubles to me. He and his girlfriend were originally discussing marriage, but they ended up arguing over buying a house in Hangzhou. He wanted to buy a new property in Future Sci-Tech City, while his girlfriend insisted on buying an old, run-down school district apartment in West Lake District. Neither could convince the other, and now his girlfriend has moved back to her rented place, essentially taking a temporary break to cool off.
Lin Jing: Brother Xuan, have you gotten any new dolls recently? I saw you posted a MOLLY Lantern Festival edition on your Moments.
Lei Mingxuan: Yeah, I just bought a box and was lucky enough to pull the hidden one. Lately, I don’t know why, but I’m really into those Chinese-style MOLLY figures.
Lin Jing: Really? I remember you used to collect a bit of every series.

Lei Mingxuan: I do collect them all, but my taste has changed recently. During the Spring Festival, while organizing my cabinet, I arranged the MOLLY Spring Festival edition, the Mid-Autumn Jade Rabbit edition, and the Peking Opera mask edition together, and found them particularly appealing. Now, whenever I see MOLLY releasing traditional festival or Chinese-style themed editions, I really want to collect them, whether they are basic editions or hidden ones.
Lin Jing: Got it, you've been "planted" by traditional culture. It seems I'll have to pay attention to this kind of thing when swapping kids with you in the future.
Dad, I've already passed the ladder to you. I'm now going to change the water basin in the bedroom, and I'll use a mop to deal with the water in the living room.

Lei Mingxuan: I'm back from the community health service center. I sprained my ankle, and after the doctor's examination, it was determined to be a mild issue. Medication was prescribed, and rest was recommended.
Zhang Wei: @Lei Mingxuan @Li Na Have you heard? Haozi has been having a really tough time lately.
Lei Mingxuan: What's up? Is he wrestling with product requirements again?

Li Na: I was just about to mention that! His company organized an internal competition called "The Strongest Product Manager," and the prize money is quite substantial. He's been determined to win first place, staying up for several nights in a row working on his PowerPoint presentation.

Zhang Wei: As the saying goes, extreme joy begets sorrow. The night before the final presentation, he came down with acute gastroenteritis, suffering from vomiting and diarrhea. He was immediately taken to the hospital by his colleagues for an IV drip.
Lei Mingxuan: Hahaha, and then? The championship slipped away?

Li Na: It's gone! The next day he was still in the hospital, so he had to let a junior member of his team step in to give the presentation. Although the presentation went fairly well, the judges felt it wasn't the original presenter and deducted points for impression, ultimately resulting in a second-place finish. Haozi is now filled with regret, saying he wishes he hadn't eaten that extremely spicy hotpot.
Lin Jing: Brother Lei, have you tried the new HIRONO Crying Baby series? I bought three, and they were all basic versions. I'm so upset.
Lei Mingxuan: I didn't draw. My mindset has changed now, Jingjing.
Lin Jing: Huh? What do you mean? You used to be a blind box fanatic.

Lei Mingxuan: Yeah, but now I feel it's just not worth it to keep spending money on hidden editions, with piles of duplicate basic ones taking up space. The passion has faded, and it's time to return to rationality.

Lei Mingxuan: If I really like a series now, I either buy the whole box to guarantee a complete set or go to Xianyu to purchase the one or two confirmed items I definitely want. It saves me trouble, money, and frustration. The thrill of blind draws no longer satisfies this old man, haha.
Lin Jing: ...You make a very good point, and I'm at a loss for words. It seems I need to reflect on my shopping impulses as well.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, how have you been lately? Has your ankle fully recovered?
Lei Mingxuan: Much better, Nana. I've started to slowly get back into roller skating. How about you? Is it hot in Hangzhou lately?
Li Na: It's so hot! By the way, I had a video call with Wei Ge a couple of days ago, and he complained that he's been exhausted lately, running to the building materials market every day.
Lei Mingxuan: What's up with him? Did he land another big project?

Li Na: It's not about work. It's that his family's school district house has finally been handed over. They're now in the midst of a flurry of renovations, hoping to get everything done before next spring so the child can transfer schools.
Lin Jing: Xuan Ge, have you seen any interesting new products lately? What do you think about Pop Mart's new series?
Lei Mingxuan: Jingjing, I've seen that one. The design is okay, but it feels a bit too similar to others. Lately, I've been more interested in things that are different.

Lei Mingxuan: Moreover, I feel that this series will have stronger user stickiness, somewhat penetrating into the core model toy circle. In the long run, its appreciation potential might be greater than that of purely decorative pieces. I plan to collect a few and see.

Lei Mingxuan: Haozi? What happened to him? Something about work?
Shen Jie: It's not work-related, it's about daily life. The apartment he's renting seems to be an old building, and the water pipe suddenly burst.
Lei Mingxuan: What? Is everyone okay? Was the damage significant?

Shen Jie: The people are fine, but the living room is completely flooded. I've been arguing with the landlord these past two days about repairs and compensation, and I also have to find a temporary place to stay for a few days. It's quite a headache.
Han Dong: Mingxuan, we're playing pool at the usual spot tonight. Are you coming?
Lei Mingxuan: Come on! It's a slow day at the shop today, and I was just adjusting the playlist.
Han Dong: Oh? Changing the style? Weren't you always playing pop songs before?
Lei Mingxuan: Yes, I've recently become obsessed with Lo-Fi Hip Hop. It's that kind of low-fidelity hip hop with a slightly grainy texture and a very comfortable rhythm.

Lei Mingxuan: I think it fits the current atmosphere of the shop perfectly—not too noisy, allowing customers to relax and take their time browsing. It feels more fitting than playing jazz or City Pop before.
Li Na: Brother Xuan, have you been in touch with Brother Wei lately? He seems to be in a bit of a low mood recently.
Lei Mingxuan: We just played ball last week, and he seemed fine. What's wrong?

Li Na: His wife Xiaoya was laid off by the company in early March and is now unemployed at home. Brother Wei is probably under a lot of pressure, what with the mortgage, car loan, and a child to support.
Lei Mingxuan: Huh? He didn't mention this to me. Xiao Ya is quite capable at work, so she must have found a new job quickly, right?

Li Na: I've submitted quite a few resumes and attended several interviews, but either the salary wasn't satisfactory or the position didn't match. I'm still looking. Let's show more concern for Brother Wei.
Shen Jie: Brother, our company just held the summer product meeting. This year, high-saturation colors and oversized cuts are in trend. How are the T-shirts coming along on your end?
Lei Mingxuan: Of course, the cut and color are important, but when I'm choosing a T-shirt, the functionality of the fabric comes first.
Shen Jie: Oh? What exactly do you mean? Isn't pure cotton texture the most classic?

Lei Mingxuan: Pure cotton tends to stick uncomfortably to the skin when sweating. I mainly focus on blended fabrics with good moisture-wicking and quick-drying properties, like COOLMAX or those commonly used by some sportswear brands. Shanghai summers are muggy and hot, so customers will only come back if they feel comfortable wearing the clothes.
Shen Jie: That makes sense. Functional clothing is indeed a trend. I have some supplier information here; I'll send it to you later for a look.

Lei Mingxuan: Hello, ma'am. We sincerely apologize for the incorrect size of the jeans you purchased. After carefully reviewing your feedback, we have confirmed that this particular style indeed runs smaller than usual. We are very sorry for the inconvenience this has caused. If it is convenient for you, please feel free to return to the store at any time, and we will handle the matter properly for you.

Dear Mr. Lei,  

This is Zheng Kai from Century Hui Property Management. This is a written confirmation regarding the matters we discussed this morning:  

1. Security patrols and fire emergency plans for the Spring Festival period (from New Year's Eve to the third day of the lunar new year) have been fully deployed.  
2. Notices for the reopening day on the fourth day of the lunar new year have been sent to the merchant group. Please also take note of them.  
3. As for the online lecture on "Retail Digital Transformation and Practical Strategies for Private Domain Traffic" mentioned earlier, I will send you the link via WeChat later. I hope it will be helpful to you.  

Wishing you a happy Spring Festival in advance!
summarized_info: Lei Mingxuan received a text message from the property manager Zheng Kai, confirming the security and fire prevention plans for the Spring Festival at the mall, as well as the opening arrangements on the fourth day of the lunar new year. The message also mentioned that a link to an online lecture would be shared.

Alright. This fund may experience greater volatility compared to the previous bond fund. It is suitable for medium to long-term investment, so maintaining a dollar-cost averaging mindset is advisable. I will inform you if there are any significant fluctuations.

Yes. I'll check this afternoon. If it really can't be fixed, I'll call your mechanic, Master He, and ask if he knows how to repair home appliances. Our Siemens appliance has been in use for almost ten years.

Master He, thank you for making a special trip this afternoon! My dad said you fixed that Siemens washing machine—it was just an old belt. As expected of an experienced master, you know your way around home appliances. I'll transfer the repair fee to you via WeChat.

You're too kind, Boss Lei! It was no trouble at all, just a small favor. Your father is a very nice man—he even made me some tea. I've received the payment, so feel free to reach out anytime if there are any issues with your home appliances or car.

(Li Na) Mingxuan, I've been running out of shows to watch lately. Do you have any recommendations for lighthearted and funny anime? Nothing too action-packed, please.

(Lei Mingxuan) I have to recommend "Spy x Family"! Anya is just too adorable, perfect for watching while eating. It's light-hearted and healing, with great art style. Alternatively, "Jujutsu Kaisen" is also excellent—though it's action-packed, the pacing and production quality are top-notch.
